info.description:
The following is a list of contracts to integrate 'Available Properties' into a public website. The first contract /v2AvailableProperties/JSON provides comprehensive array of currrent available properties with details.

Every time the call is made to this contract it provides the current list at the time of the call. If a property is no longer showing in the latest call that existed in previous calls you can use the /v2PreviousAvailableProperty/JSON/ contract to get information regarding the leased or withdrawn status and comments of the properties.

You can get a list of related images to a Property in Base64 encoded string (/v2AvailablePropertyImages/JSON) or a URL (/v2AvailablePropertyImagesURL/JSON/) directly to the JPG file. Use the Base64 encoded option to download the images to your website (NOTE: Do not use this contract to render images per request as the resulting request is too slow to handle this). You can use the URL requests to link directly to your site.
info.title: Palace Advertising Integration API

get.summary: All current available properties with detailed data
get.description: This shows all 'Available Properties' with detailed data
This shows withdrawn or leased details of a previous 'Available Property'

200.description: Withdrawn or leased details of a previous 'Available Property'

get.summary: Array of images and meta data
get.description: Images (Base64 encoded) and meta data related to 'Available Property'

200.description: Images (Base64 encoded) and meta data related to 'Available Property'

get.summary: Array of image URL's and meta data
get.description: Images (URL Links) and meta data related to 'Available Property'

200.description: Images (URL Links) and meta data related to 'Available Property'

PropertyChangeCode.description: Code indicating how many times this record has been updated.  The code is incremented by 1 on each update.  This can also be used to track if the record has been updated since the last request.

PropertyCode.description: The 'Internal Code' of the 'Property'.  This code is only unique within the client database.  It is recommended that you use 'PropertyCodeGlobal' if you are making the data public or consuming property information from multiple client databases.

PropertyCodeGlobal.description: The 'Global Code' of the 'Property'.  This code is unique across ALL Palace databases.  It is recommended that you use 'PropertyCodeGlobal' if you are making the data public or consuming property information from multiple client databases.

PropertyDateAvailable.description: Date the property is available from.  This will be formatted as yyyy-MM-dd

PropertyGrid.description: Generally is used as in 'Internal' reference for a 'Map Grid' for grouping purposes.

PropertyManagementType.description: A description of the 'Management Type' of the property.  Although these descriptions can be defined by the user, Palace has a 'Pattern Criteria' definiting 4 specific types of 'Managements'. Descriptions containing the word 'Manage' specifies a residential management.  Descriptions containing the word 'Casual' specifies a casual property. Descriptions containing the word 'Commercial' specifies a commercial management.  Descriptions containing the word 'Holiday' specifies a holiday management

PropertyName.description: This is user defined 'Free Form' text giving a name to a property (NOTE: This is not the same as the address of the property)

PropertyOwnerCode.description: Internal code assigned to the 'Owner' of the property.

PropertyRentAmount.description: This is the amount of the rent.

PropertyRentalPeriod.description: This is related to the the 'PropertyRentAmount' field (e.g. 200 / Week).  The 'Rental Period' indicates how often the rent should be paid on this property.  Options are Day, Week, Fortnight, Month

PropertySortCode.description: This is a user defined code for sorting.  Generally, this will be the same as the 'Street Addres' name

PropertyStatus.description: This value will be 'Active' or 'Inactive' and indicates if the 'Property' is an active management at this time (NOTE: An 'Inactive' management may suggest the 'Property' is having work done at this time and cannot currently be rented)

PropertyUnit.description: The 'Unit' of the 'Property'.  If displaying the full 'Property Address' and a 'Unit' exists, the system should display 'Unit / PropertyAddress1' (e.g. 1/15 Stuart Street).

PropertyExternalCodes.description: External Codes provided by 3rd parties that require references to their own services

AvailablePropertyCustomList.description: Companies can elect to have extra field names and values that are setup specifically for their company. These can be diplayed in this 'Custom List' array with a related 'Name' and 'Value' entry. If none are setup this will return an empty array

AvailablePropertyFeatures.description: These are a specific set of 'Feature' entries avaiable for each property.

PropertyAdvertText.example: Come and see this great property in the heart of the city...

PropertyClass.description: This will be one of the following options (Apartment, House, Home and Income, Lifestyle, Unit, Townhouse, Holiday Home, Section Res, Flats).

PropertyFeatureDetails.description: Free form list of other features

PropertyFurnishings.description: Free form list of furnishings within the property

PropertyGeographicLocation.description: latitude and longitude separted by : (From Google Maps API)

PropertyHeader.example: New Property for Rent (Be Quick, don't miss out!)

PropertyNewConstruction.description: Is the 'Property' a new construction (Yes / No)

PropertyParking.description: This can be a number or free form text

PropertyPetsAllowed.description: Is the 'Property' allowed to have pets (Yes / No)

PropertyPublishAddress.description: Should the 'Property Address' be published online

PropertyPublishEntry.description: Should the 'Property' entry be published online

PropertySmokersAllowed.description: Is the 'Property' allowed smoking on premise (Yes / No)

PropertyStories.description: Number of Storeys of the property

PropertyWebLinkURL.description: Link to website or listing URL

PropertySuburbCode.description: External Code Reference (NOTE: Based to 'Suburb Type')

PropertySuburbDistrictOrPostcode.description: Suburb District (NOTE: In 'Australia' this displays a 'Post Code')

PropertySuburbType.description: The 'Suburb Type' is describes where the source of the suburb code originates

PropertyCodeGlobal.description: The 'Global Code' of the 'Property'.  This code is unique across ALL Palace databases.  It is recommended that you use 'PropertyCodeGlobal' if you are making the data public or consuming property information from multiple client databases.

PropertyDateAvailableRemoved.description: When the 'Date Available' was removed from the 'Property' (Marking the property as no longer available).  This will be formatted as yyyy-MM-dd

PropertyDateAvailableRemovedReason.example:
Property Date Available Removed
Reason : Withdrawn
Comments : Tenant not vacating
PropertyDateAvailableRemovedReason.description: Descripton of the 'Reason' the 'Date Available' was removed.  This is separated by a colon (See example above)

PropertyImageCode.description: Internal 'Image Code' (This is only unique to a specific image)

PropertyImageCodeGlobal.description: Global 'Image Code' (This is unique across ALL Palace databases)

PropertyImageCode.description: Internal 'Image Code' (This is only unique to a specific image)

PropertyImageCodeGlobal.description: Global 'Image Code' (This is unique across ALL Palace databases)

PropertyImageURLThumbnailMedium.description: URL to Image (Resized to medium thumbnail)

PropertyImageURLThumbnailSmall.description: URL to Image (Resized to small thumbnail)
